lexUnit.name: trickle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flow in a small stream.

sentence.text: When Kalchu pulled it up again there was blood trickling from its nostril .
Even from where Beth stood , she could see the blood trickling down Cissie 's arm .
The memory of him lying there does n't worry me , nor the memory of the blood trickling out of his body .
Delaney turned from the rain trickling down the window .
In spite of the rain trickling down our necks , our spirits lifted .
Their lungs rasped from the effort , the rain trickled down their foreheads to mix with the sweat , their energy gone .
Sweat trickled from my temple into my eye ; I blinked and blinked again .
Sweat trickled down his inner arms , formed on his forehead .
But one runnel of sweat began to trickle down his forehead from under his headdress .
Tears trickled down the cheeks of some stout veterans .
This time the tears trickled down Katherine 's cheeks .
Tears flowed down her cheeks , trickling through her fingers .
Tears trickled from the corners of her eyes , and she knuckled them away fiercely .
Undo the coupling slightly so water can trickle into the container , and open the air vent to increase the flow rate .
A runlet of water trickled past the end of the hut .
Her self-confidence oozed away like water trickling into sand .
As I looked up , I saw that water was beginning to slop in and trickle down the wall .
The sea came in with a weightless rush and trickled between dry rocks .
Laps of water slapped against the boat , like wine trickling from a bottle .

Then the black-and-white house in its green and secret place brooded undisturbed through the chills and fogs of winter , the smoke trickling reluctantly from its chimneys to cling like rags to the bare tree-tops above the roof .
Water trickled from the brown earth near the roots of the bush and traced a dark line through the tall grass .
In the silence you could hear the logs crackling and the earth trickling from the pot of an overturned fern .
The sweat was running down from his hair line and trickling into his eyes .
A drop of soap trickled into his eyes and he rubbed it only to find that he had created more pain .
He always said … 'She gulped again and a tear trickled through the make-up .
In every case they pictured a pastoral place where streams trickled through lush meadows , waterfalls fell into cool , sparkling pools or the sea gently bathed a sandy beach .
Nathan boomed and brayed so enthusiastically that his mother had to mop up a dribble of saliva that trickled out of the corner of his mouth .
He turned her outraged face to him , bruised from the beating , and to her fury a tear trickled out of one purple , puffy eye .
As a tear trickled out of one eye .
A little laughter trickled out of the ranks .
Here and there the open doors of furnaces glowed a dangerous red , and in the far corner of the building what looked like a stream of molten lava trickled down a curved channel from roof to floor .
Both men were soaking as Lawton make his report , the drops trickling down their wet suits .
It collects in a pool near the gate , thence it trickles down the road .
But with the industry in recession , and record sales dropping , the hitherto dependable cashflow was trickling down at an alarming rate .
The captain 's gaze was fixed unblinkingly on the depth gauge , watching its hypnotic fall , great beads of perspiration trickling down his forehead .
Kalchu picked up a handful of maize kernels , inspected them for a minute , and let them trickle back through his fingers .
Minimum air could go in , trickle out .
The chips were down , the levels were split and the Scotch trickled over the rocks .
A stream trickled artificially , and birds were singing .
The cupola turned out to be a kind of gigantic cauldron erected high in one corner of the building where she had earlier noticed what looked like volcanic lava trickling downwards .
But little of the earnings trickle downwards : most of the foreign currency earned goes on imports of food and goods demanded by the predominantly white and affluent visitors .
